txt.en:
'With the Uruk Drukordh slain, the threat of the Orcs is lessened, and I am free to come to the Council of Esteldín.

'You should bring word to Halbarad that we shall attend him, and that we will arrive soon!

'Your brave deeds may yet prove a strong foundation for our defences.'

'The message you bear is joyous, twice over! The Uruk Drukordh is dead and the Elves have agreed to come to the Council? \n\n'You have done very well, for the might of the Elves shall improve our lot all the more. You have my thanks for this!'
'You should go now to Halbarad and bring him word that we are coming.'
Book 3, Chapter 5, Part III of III: Might of the Elves
'With the Uruk-chieftain dead, Lin Giliath shall be at least a measure safer. But for how long?'
After defeating the Uruk Drukordh, Gildor told you that the Elves of Lin Giliath shall come to the Council of Esteldín.
'A Council of Elves, Men and dwarves? A sight not seen in a very long time, I ween.'
Halbarad can be found in Esteldín.\n\nGildor told you to bring word to Halbarad that the Elves have agreed to come to the Council of Esteldín.
